item.title: Ubisoft Really Doesn‚Äôt Want You To See Its Canceled Prince Of Persia Remake
item.content:encoded:
It‚Äôs been less than a week since Ubisoft announced it was cancelling several projects, including the long-awaited Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake. That project had apparently been struggling since its 2020 announcement, having essentially started over from scratch back in 2023. But while the remake itself may never see the light of day, some concept art and screenshots from the game‚Äôs 2024 pre-alpha version have started circulating online. Ubisoft, however, is doing its best to get them taken down before anyone can see what might have been.

The art and images are from a 2024 workshop presentation, and though they don‚Äôt show the game in motion, there‚Äôs enough here to get a sense of what the team at Ubisoft was working toward before the project was canceled. The presentation was posted to YouTube, then subsequently copyright-struck by Ubisoft. Fans still managed to grab the images, though, and have been sharing them across social media.

Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake ‚Äì the full workshop presentation 2024 was leaked on YouTube yesterday!

I‚Äôve put together some of what was shown during the conference ‚Äî everything looks absolutely beautiful!üò©üòç

(Pre-Alpha, Early 2024)
Soundtrack is from the remake! pic.twitter.com/3BDRlFlgHJ

‚Äî Prince of Persia Universe (@princeozzyX) January 27, 2026

From the sound of it, the Sands of Time remake was even further along by the time it was canceled earlier this month, as Eman Ayaz, an actor who has hinted she was playing a role in the game, had shot a marketing promo for the game just two months prior.

‚ÄúI pushed myself past old limits and discovered things I didn‚Äôt even know existed inside of me through the lives that I lived in this character,‚Äù Ayaz says in a YouTube video. ‚ÄúIt was something that‚Äôs completely out of the range of any character that I‚Äôve been cast in in the past. And I got to do things I‚Äôve never gotten to do before. And it brought out what I honestly believe is the best performance of my career. And now nobody is ever going to see that. I can‚Äôt stress enough how much I had kind of planned my life around the release of this project.‚Äù

While the Sands of Time remake is probably the most high-profile cancellation at Ubisoft this month, the company shelved five other games and delayed seven more as part of a larger restructuring. Don‚Äôt worry though, Beyond Good and Evil 2 is still coming.



https://kotaku.com/prince-of-persia-sands-of-time-art-leak-canceled-remake-2000663501
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: LEGO Adds the Looney Tunes Sweetheart Tweety Bird to Its Valentine‚Äôs Day Deal at a Record Low
item.content:encoded:
The LEGO Looney Tunes Sweetheart Tweety Bird Figure is a 412-piece kit that lets you turn the iconic yellow canary into a heart-inspired display you can pose and change up. Once you have completed the figure and used the posable head, wings, tail, and feet, you can choose to either position Tweety on the pedestal, cloud, as a matchmaker, or by removing Tweety from the base, placing the bouquet under his arm, and attaching the heart above his head so he appears to be providing a gift.

You can go to Amazon and purchase the LEGO Looney Tunes Sweetheart Tweety Bird Figure for $24, which is $11 cheaper than the original retail price of $35, and a 31% discount.

See at Amazon

A LEGO project featuring the Looney Tunes‚Äô most iconic bird

This Valentine-themed build of Tweety offers a couple of obvious options to style the figure so it continues to interest you after you finish the build. First, you can put Tweety on the pedestal cloud, place the bow and arrow within his wings, and create a fun playfulness by posing Tweety as Cupid to fit in with Valentine‚Äôs Day on a nightstand or desk. Second, when you want to tone things down a bit, you can take Tweety off the pedestal, give him the bouquet, and place the heart on top of his head so he looks like the giver.

The use of posable joints allows the LEGO Looney Tunes Sweetheart Tweety Bird Figure to appear more lively than a fixed decoration that never changes position. Additionally, since the model is made from LEGO elements, you can move some pieces around if you would like to slightly change how he looks or stands, without using a specialized tool or additional components.

The design features and functionality of this set also enable it to serve a dual purpose as a decorative item rather than simply a one-time build that you throw in storage. The pedestal is compact, so the space required for this item will be small enough to fit on a dresser corner, a bookshelf, or an office shelf.

The step-by-step instructions for building the model are intended to create a fun, satisfying experience as each part goes into place. The directions start by showing you how to form the body and head of Tweety, and then proceed to the pedestal and accessories so that you see the character develop in stages. Once the figure is placed on display, you have a charming Looney Tunes figure that you can re-position as many times as you desire, and given the fact that the item is available for $24 on sale, down from the normal $35, it makes for a simple and affordable little project that‚Äôs worth building.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/lego-adds-the-looney-tunes-sweetheart-tweety-bird-to-its-valentines-day-deal-at-a-record-low-2000663257

item.title: Even Animal Crossing Fans Can‚Äôt Escape AI Slop
item.content:encoded:
Not even the Animal Crossing community is safe from AI ensloppification.

With the Animal Crossing: New Horizons 3.0 update only a few weeks old, players have been hard at work sprucing up their islands and posting pictures of all their hard decorating work. But some have been using generative AI to ‚Äúenhance‚Äù their photos or fabricate them altogether, and fans are getting pissed. 

Sharing stylistic edits of Animal Crossing screenshots online is a foundational pillar of the game‚Äôs community. Photos are typically edited to enhance the game‚Äôs lighting and shadows, or put through filters to achieve a certain vibe. Photos with the best vibes are rewarded with likes, upvotes, or whatever the clout currency is for a particular social media website. However, Polygon reports that on X and elsewhere, AC screenshots enhanced with AI have started trending, often without disclosure that genAI was used.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs time we talk about the AI use in Animal Crossing aesthetic posts that are trending,‚Äù wrote user Cozyberru on X. In a thread, they highlight how a number of recently trending AC screenshots were likely created with genAI, pointing out the usual suspects of funky-looking numbers and warped textures on background items. But their issue isn‚Äôt so much with using the tool itself. ‚ÄúAll I am asking is to be honest and disclose your use of AI or editing,‚Äù they wrote.

Animal Crossing has thousands of little knick-knacks, pieces of furniture, and more. Not sharing that an Animal Crossing photo has been enhanced with AI can lead to confusion in players who might want to get their hands on something they don‚Äôt know has been wholly made up.

In the thread, one commenter thanked Cozyberru for their service. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been sitting here thinking, ‚Äòis there a mod or hack or glitch going around that I don‚Äôt know?‚Äô Because there‚Äôs no way to place that item that close to the furniture as much as I want to.‚Äù

Cozyberru doesn‚Äôt explicitly share their feelings about genAI, but others shared theirs in the thread‚Äôs comments and elsewhere online. Though it‚Äôs not called out specifically in the rules, it seems the Animal Crossing subreddit has a strict ‚ÄúNo genAI policy.‚Äù In a post regarding fanart, a moderator advised community members not to report anything that wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúblatantly NSFW or AI.‚Äù In another post, a user reposted a video of their island after the original was taken down for using text-to-speech AI voiceover. 



https://kotaku.com/animal-crossing-new-horizons-ai-slop-instagram-2000663468
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: This Ryzen 7 Mini PC (32GB RAM, 1TB SSD) Drops to Its Lowest Price and Is Selling Fast as a Mac Mini Alternative
item.content:encoded:
Desk space is a luxury these days, especially for people working from home or studying in smaller apartments. A full-size tower PC can feel excessive when all you really need is reliable performance which you can get from something more compact. Mini PCs solve that problem neatly, and the ACEMAGIC Mini PC is a strong example of how much power can fit into a surprisingly small box. Right now, it‚Äôs also much cheaper than usual, thanks to Amazon discounts that shave as much as $240 off select configurations.

The first thing you notice about the ACEMAGIC Mini PC is its size. It‚Äôs compact enough to sit unobtrusively on a desk, tuck onto a shelf, or mount behind a monitor. It works for students, professionals, or really anyone building a clean, minimalist workspace.

ACEMAGIC is offering multiple configurations to suit different needs and budgets.

See at Amazon

The entry-level option comes with 16GB of RAM and a 512GB SSD, powered by an AMD Ryzen 7 6800H processor with integrated graphics. This setup is more than capable of handling everyday tasks like web browsing, document editing, video streaming, and light creative work. It normally sells for $459, but the current discount drops the price to $329, marking a 28% savings.

Users who need extra power can step up to the higher-end model, which includes 32GB of RAM and a 1TB SSD. This version runs on the AMD Ryzen 7 H 255 processor and is better suited for heavier multitasking, larger and more plentiful files, and more demanding applications. Its usual $759 price tag has been cut to $519, a 32% discount that brings premium specs into a far more approachable range. Storage expansion is also supported, with room to add an additional SSD for up to 4TB total capacity.

Small Stature, Big Performance

In daily use, performance feels snappy and responsive. The system handles office software, photo editing, and multitasking without slowing down, particularly in the 32GB configuration. Windows 11 Pro comes preinstalled, so setup is quick and straightforward right out of the box.

Display options are well supported. Using USB4 Type-C or DisplayPort 2.0, it can drive an 8K display at 60Hz. An HDMI port supports 4K at 60Hz. The three together means up to three monitors can be connected at once without any extra adapters.

Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 4.2 keep wireless connections fast and stable, while six USB 3.2 ports provide enough room for wired peripherals. Cooling is handled by dual centrifugal fans, a layered fin design, and a dedicated aluminum heatsink for the SSD, keeping noise and temperatures under control.

For anyone looking to reclaim desk space without giving up performance, the ACEMAGIC Mini PC is worth a look‚Äîespecially with current discounts pushing the top configuration down to just $519.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/this-ryzen-7-mini-pc-32gb-ram-1tb-ssd-drops-to-its-lowest-price-and-is-selling-fast-as-a-mac-mini-alternative-2000663260
